head.title: World Briefing | Europe: Serbia: Delay For Presidential Election

identified-content.classifier: Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Government, Philanthropy and NGO

hedline.hl1: World Briefing | Europe: Serbia: Delay For Presidential Election

abstract.p: Acting Pres Natasa Micic of Serbia says voters will not have chance to elect successor for up to six months; this draws criticism from popular candidate Vojislav Kostunica; Micic is close ally of Serb Prime Min Zoran Djindjac, who has had long power struggle with Kostunica; photo (S)

block.p: Serbia's acting president, Natasa Micic, announced that voters would not have a chance to elect a successor for up to six months, drawing criticism from a popular candidate, Vojislav Kostunica. Ms. Micic is a close ally of the Serbian prime minister, Zoran Djindjic, who has had a long power struggle with Mr. Kostunica, the former president of the former Yugoslavia.

Serbia's acting president, Natasa Micic, announced that voters would not have a chance to elect a successor for up to six months, drawing criticism from a popular candidate, Vojislav Kostunica. Ms. Micic is a close ally of the Serbian prime minister, Zoran Djindjic, who has had a long power struggle with Mr. Kostunica, the former president of the former Yugoslavia.
